title.narrative: Capacity building of institutions & structures in charge of environment &climate
Kapacitetsbyggnad av institutioner & strukturer som ansvarar för miljö & klimat

description.narrative: Stödja den maliska staten med en djupgående analys för att identifiera behov av kapacitetsbyggnad inom institutioner och strukturer som är ansvariga för frågor relaterade till miljö och klimatförändring.

Support the government of Mali in the definition of its needs of capacity building of Structures and Institutions in Charge of Environment and Climate change based on a throughout diagnosis. Support the State Capacity in sustainable management of environment and climate change.Through a lengthy process, the donor’s harmonization and coordination group in Environment and climate change together with the government of Mali have elaborated a “Conceptual Note” on the current situation of the Institutions and Structures in charge of the Coordination in Environment and climate change. Following this, the government submitted Terms and References to the donors’ community for organizational audits (self-assessment audits and external audits) and for the design of a “Capacity Building Programme of Institutions and Structures in Charge of Environment and Climate Change including the process to consolidate and update its NDC. The intention is to design a structured and comprehensive Programme in order to fill the institutional and policy gaps and to make these thematic more coherent and operational. After a consensus made between the donors and the government and after having received a “Funding Request dated March 19, 2020”, it was decided by the Coordination and Harmonization Group that Sweden given its experience funds and coordinates these audits and the design of the Programme. The intention is that the future Programme which will be planned from 2021 to 2025 be funded through a “Basket Funding Mechanism” with shared responsibilities among donors. The budget The overall budget for the event is worth 241 963 000 FCFA (4 034 000 SEK) to be funded by Sweden. The overall draft budget was 300 000 000 FCFA (5 000 000 SEK). Through the comments from the Embassy, the budget was reduced by 19.35 %. From the total budget of 4. 034 MSEK, 70 % will be used for consultancy services (national and international) while 30 % will be used for validation workshops and management costs for AEDD which is a “Public Administrative Establishment” with financial and administrative autonomy. Such status makes it obliged to generate resources from all operations it should be involved in. The costs for audits/diagnosis are 60 000 000 FCFA (1 MSEK or 24. 80%) while the costs for the Programme formulation where most of consultants are internationals are: 181 963 000 FCFA (3.034 MSEK or 75.2%).The overall budget will be managed by AEDD. No fund is forwarded to other entities.The Embassy assesses that given the objectives cited above and the intended better coordination and capacity vis á vis the Environmental protection, the public education and awareness making about climate change adaptation and anti- desertification work, the budget seems adequate. The funding will permit more efficiency and effectiveness of environmental protection and climate change while improving coordination and harmonization.

The global objective of the Support to Capacity Building of Institutions and Structures in Charge of the Coordination of Environment and Climate is to conduct self-assessments and external organizational audits of these Institutions and Structures in Mali and to formulate a structured and comprehensive Capacity development Programme for all. Support the government of Mali in the definition of its needs of capacity building ofStructures and Institutions in Charge of Environment and Climate change based on athroughout diagnosis Support the State in the formulation of the Capacity development Programme in repose to the audits.

participating-org.narrative: AEDD/Agence de l'Environnement et du Developpement Durable

tag.narrative: 13.b - Främja mekanismer för att höja förmågan till effektiv klimatrelaterad planering och förvaltning i de minst utvecklade länderna, med särskilt fokus på kvinnor, ungdomar samt lokala och marginaliserade samhällen.

13.b - Promote mechanisms for raising capacity for effective climate change-related planning and management in least developed countries and small island developing States, including focusing on women, youth and local and marginalized communities.
15.9 - By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts.
15.9 - Senast 2020 integrera ekosystemens och den biologiska mångfaldens värden i nationella och lokala planerings- och utvecklingsprocesser, i strategier för fattigdomsminskning samt i räkenskaper.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
17.14 - Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development.
17.14 - Föra en mer samstämmig politik för hållbar utveckling.

title.narrative: Agreement on contribution to Capacity Building of Institutions and structures in charge of Environment and climate
Decision on Contribution Capacity Building of institutions and structures in charge of environment and climate

description.narrative: The Programme should be formulated and submitted to Sida by March 31, 2021. But due to COVID pandemic and the political crisis which delayed the launch of the process of recruitment of consultants, diagnostic and formulation of the Programme, this deadline has been extended to June 30, 2021 and the final reporting to September 30, 2021. Despite these contingencies, some key activities have been performed and key results achieved: Development and participatory validation of Terms of references for the recruitment of a consultancy firm for the external audits A national consultancy firm has been recruited Consultations have been made with key stakeholders in Bamako and in various regions of Mali Organizational external and internal audit performed on all the Institutions and Structures in charge of and Environment and Climate Change Coordination in Mali A draft report has been produced, analyzed, and commented through workshops by all involved stakeholders including the donor’s harmonization Group in Environment and Climate Change A final report considering all comments with main findings and recommendations, has been elaborated Development and participatory validation of Terms of references for the recruitment of an international consultancy firm for the formulation of the Programme. Financial Statement: Resources: 254 522 415 FCFA Expenditures: 54 467 740 FCFA Balance: 200 054 675 FCFA The finacial statements are clear.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
